intro: Prangos asperula, commonly known as the rough bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. The plant features hairy, upright stems and produces bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Prangos asperula is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun.
